author: The Telegraph
title: Heston Blumenthal: pulled pork shoulder recipe
text: Discover more summer recipes » Everyone enjoys a summer barbecue, whether it’s in the blazing sunshine or with the occasional crack in the cloud. For a gourmet grill, try this melt-in-the-mouth barbecue pork shoulder courtesy of celebrity chef Heston Blumenthal. The ingredient that makes this recipe extra special, and saves time, is the Heston from Waitrose Ultimate Barbecue Sauce. The preparation is straightforward, as Heston explains: “Get a whole bone-out pork shoulder, grab some of Heston from Waitrose Ultimate Barbecue Sauce, mix up the dry rub and follow the instructions below. The result is pork that’s full of flavour and fantastically tender.” Heston’s barbecue pork shoulder Serves: 8-10 Preparation: 20 mins, plus overnight Cooking time: 8-10 hours Ingredients • 1 tsp ground ginger • 1 tsp sweet smoked paprika • 1 tsp mustard powder • 1 tsp salt • 2kg Waitrose Free Range Whole Pork Shoulder, bone out • 2x 175ml Heston from Waitrose Ultimate Barbecue Sauce Method To barbecue 1. Place all the dry spice ingredients and salt in a bowl and mix. Place the pork shoulder in a bowl and sprinkle the spice rub over the the meat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. 2. Prepare an indirect heat barbecue by stacking the coals to one side of the pit and place a heatproof tray filled with water on the other side. This creates an area which will gently smoke the meat. Light the coals, place the grill over the barbecue. Preheat for 30 minutes. 3. Oil the grill and place the pork shoulder on the cooler side of it (over the water tray) skin side up. Cook for 4 hours, adding more coals if necessary. The water tray should be constantly simmering. Add more water if required. 4. Double wrap the joint with foil and place back on to the barbecue for a further 4-6 hours until the meat is falling apart. 5. Shred the meat with two forks and serve with the barbecue sauce. To cook conventionally Preheat oven to 200C/gas mark 6. Place pork on a rack over a tin half full of hot water. Roast for 30 minutes. Reduce to 100C/gas mark ½ and cook for 3½ hours. Double-wrap joint with foil and place back on the rack to roast for a further 4 hours until the meat is falling apart. Your summer of food In the last of the series, the Telegraph and Waitrose are featuring summer barbecue recipes from Michelin-starred chef Heston Blumenthal to help make your alfresco eating and home entertaining extra special. Using ingredients from the Waitrose and Heston from Waitrose ranges, discover how you can bring culinary flair to the table.
